intro: Danaea simplicifolia var. trifoliata, commonly known as the three-leaf flame flower, is a striking tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers that are often adorned with contrasting white or yellow markings. The leaves are typically trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three leaflets, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
